ygData.subject: RE: Armor & Absorption is all AC.
ygData.msgSnippet: Point being 4 people said that armor type does make a difference in damage received, one person said it doesn t and that he has direct confirmation from Verant
ygData.messageBody:
Point being 4 people said that armor type does make a difference in damage
received, one person said it doesn't and that he has direct confirmation
from Verant that it doesn't. I don't know about you but very rarely will
Verant give out this kind of information, if at all. And someone saying
'because Verant said so' without saying where he heard that is like someone
telling you 'My friend is a GM and he is going to ban you'. No, most of
the time if a player tells what he has found in his experience within the
game I will tend to listen to them more. Its when they start saying 'I
heard from Verant' or 'Brad is my brother and he said' is when I usually
don't even listen to their argument at all.

> ----------
> From: Savej@...[SMTP:Savej@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Tuesday, July 20, 1999 5:44 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Armor & Absorption is all AC.
>
> From: Savej@...
>
> <
> <<I have direct confirmation from Verant that armor type is the Damage
> Absorption constant. >>
>
> << Point: Anyone can state this. Now give us facts. What everyone has
> said
> for this thread is only conjecture. And the one thing I have found
> constant
> in EQ is that conjecture = assume (and you know the saying about assume).
> >>
> >
>
> If you can't accept what a poster is calling a fact based on your
> assessment
> of the poster than you're wasting everyone's time by filling a post asking
>
> him for more. Also note that the "because Verant said so" point wasn't
> his
> only argument.
>
> As far as the invisible, theoretical damage modifiers go, I'm curious as
> to
> why so few people are defending their existance so vehemently. I'm also
> curious as to what "facts" could possibly be brought to bear to prove or
> disprove its existance other than the conjecture of very
> experienced/methodical/intelligent players and the gospel of Verant.
>
